conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B and C. Predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A, B, and C are the starting points of the liquid.
D and E are the containers that receive the liquid.
Stream A hits the purple baffle and changes its flow direction to the right.
Stream B drops straight down at the grey slanted barrier then turns left.
Stream C drops straight down without meeting any obstacles.

premise: Stream A hits the purple baffle and changes its flow direction to the right.
conclusion: The liquid from A will flow towards container D.

premise: Stream B drops straight down at the grey slanted barrier then turns left.
conclusion: The liquid from B will flow towards container D.

premise: Stream C drops straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: The liquid from C will flow towards container E.

premise: The liquid from A will flow towards container D. The liquid from B will flow towards container D. The liquid from C will flow towards container E.
conclusion: Most of the liquids from A and B flow to the bottom compartment D, and few small mixture droplets reach E; meanwhile, stream C all flows to the container E.
